issue.title: [re2] Fix checksum of PATCH_488

labels.name: category:port-bug
labels.description: The issue is with a library, which is something the port should already support

labels.name: info:needs-maintainer-attention
labels.description: Lets the current 'on rotation' vcpkg maintainer know they need to look at this.

repository.name: vcpkg
repository.description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS

issue.body:
Fix #38146 for the `PATCH_488` checksum of `vcpkg_download_distfile`.

It might be same name file caching that causes patch changes not to be detected by `vcpkg` and `CI` in #38067.

- [X] Changes comply with the [maintainer guide](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg-docs/blob/main/vcpkg/contributing/maintainer-guide.md).
- [X] SHA512s are updated for each updated download.
- [X] The "supports" clause reflects platforms that may be fixed by this new version.
- [ ] ~Any fixed [CI baseline](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/blob/master/scripts/ci.baseline.txt) entries are removed from that file.~
- [X] Any patches that are no longer applied are deleted from the port's directory.
- [X] The version database is fixed by rerunning `./vcpkg x-add-version --all` and committing the result.
- [X] Only one version is added to each modified port's versions file.

issue.title: [re2] Build error on x64-windows

labels.name: category:port-bug
labels.description: The issue is with a library, which is something the port should already support

repository.name: vcpkg
repository.description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS

issue.body:
Package: re2:x64-windows@2024-04-01#1

**Host Environment**

- Host: x64-windows
- Compiler: MSVC 19.39.33523.0
-    vcpkg-tool version: 2024-03-14-7d353e869753e5609a1f1a057df3db8fd356e49d
    vcpkg-scripts version: 582a4de14 2024-04-11 (9 hours ago)

**To Reproduce**

`vcpkg install grpc:x64-windows`
**Failure logs**

```
-- Downloading https://github.com/google/re2/commit/9ebe4a22cad8a025b68a9594bdff3c047a111333.patch?full_index=1 -> 9ebe4a22cad8a025b68a9594bdff3c047a111333.patch...

[DEBUG] C:\temp\dev\vcpkg\downloads\9ebe4a22cad8a025b68a9594bdff3c047a111333.patch.17812.part has hash 83c1a4cc4ddd6e1443f5201f7f00cf6a0729d0a0fb8fc5068c3d80766238d72f019f1fddaeffebcc2d4322a07daf2203214121cdda039b10a5f39214b9fa8647
error: Failed to download from mirror set
error: File does not have the expected hash:
url: https://github.com/google/re2/commit/9ebe4a22cad8a025b68a9594bdff3c047a111333.patch?full_index=1
File: C:\temp\dev\vcpkg\downloads\9ebe4a22cad8a025b68a9594bdff3c047a111333.patch.17812.part
Expected hash: 167a0153bf24e77db2b8555a7d6391acf740dc4720a71e6ce19a3533c7e0a49923d9584ff32544a454837a25eedace00cb2ef9ddbf4250deb5f2c5aeda04ac26
Actual hash: 83c1a4cc4ddd6e1443f5201f7f00cf6a0729d0a0fb8fc5068c3d80766238d72f019f1fddaeffebcc2d4322a07daf2203214121cdda039b10a5f39214b9fa8647
[DEBUG] D:\a\_work\1\s\src\vcpkg\base\downloads.cpp(1031): 
[DEBUG] Time in subprocesses: 0us
[DEBUG] Time in parsing JSON: 3us
[DEBUG] Time in JSON reader: 0us
[DEBUG] Time in filesystem: 107us
[DEBUG] Time in loading ports: 0us
[DEBUG] Exiting after 427 ms (427168us)

CMake Error at scripts/cmake/vcpkg_download_distfile.cmake:32 (message):
      
      Failed to download file with error: 1
      If you are using a proxy, please check your proxy setting. Possible causes are:
      
      1. You are actually using an HTTP proxy, but setting HTTPS_PROXY variable
         to `https://address:port`. This is not correct, because `https://` prefix
         claims the proxy is an HTTPS proxy, while your proxy (v2ray, shadowsocksr
         , etc..) is an HTTP proxy. Try setting `http://address:port` to both
         HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY instead.
      
      2. If you are using Windows, vcpkg will automatically use your Windows IE Proxy Settings
         set by your proxy software. See https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg-tool/pull/77
         The value set by your proxy might be wrong, or have same `https://` prefix issue.
      
      3. Your proxy's remote server is out of service.
      
      If you've tried directly download the link, and believe this is not a temporary
      download server failure, please submit an issue at https://github.com/Microsoft/vcpkg/issues
      to report this upstream download server failure.
      

Call Stack (most recent call first):
  scripts/cmake/vcpkg_download_distfile.cmake:270 (z_vcpkg_download_distfile_show_proxy_and_fail)
  ports/re2/portfile.cmake:1 (vcpkg_download_distfile)
  scripts/ports.cmake:175 (include)



```
